p: Diospyros mespiliformis, commonly called Jackal berry or African ebony, belongs to the plant family, Ebenaceae. In Nigeria, the plant is popularly known in Hausa as Kanya and in Yoruba as Igidudu. The leaves are simple and alternate in arrangement and dark green in coloration. The plant is dioecious and flowers in the months of April and May and matured fruits are large yellow berries [ 5]. Ethno botanical application of different parts of the plant has been reported.
